Title: 🇻🇪🇵🇪 Peruvian government opposes any foreign intervention in ...
Description: 🇻🇪🇵🇪 Peruvian government opposes any foreign intervention in VenezuelaThe Peruvian government is openly opposed to any foreign intervention in Venezuela and will contribute to international pressure against the Nicolás Maduro regime to ensure a peaceful transition in favor of Edmundo González Urrutia, whom it considers president-elect, Foreign Minister Elmer Schialer said on Thursday.Asked about a possible timeframe for a transition of power in Venezuela, Schialer said that this will depend on the quality and quantity of international pressure that is exerted and how it is received in Venezuela.He also added that it will depend on how long and to what extent it will be sustainable for Venezuelans themselves in their territory.

Title: Bloomberg: Chevron filed tax returns in Venezuela despite sanctio...
Description: Bloomberg: Chevron filed tax returns in Venezuela despite sanctions, documents showChevron Corp. filed about $300 million worth of tax returns with the Venezuelan government last year, raising questions about how much President Nicolás Maduro is benefiting from the U.S. company’s oil production despite sanctions.Chevron filed documents stating that its Venezuela operations owed 8.1 billion bolivars to Seniat, Venezuela’s tax agency, as of March 2024 under its registered name in the country, Chevron Global Technology Services Company, according to documents reviewed by Bloomberg News. The company is the sole authorized payer for those operations. It’s unclear if or how Chevron paid those taxes.

Description: 🇻🇪🇺🇸 Venezuela rose to second place as a supplier of oil to the US in less than a yearVenezuela's oil exports to the United States rose 64% to reach 222,000 barrels per day (b/d) in 2024, making it its second-largest export market behind China, which bought 351,000 b/d, down 18% from the previous year, according to data provided by Reuters.Licences granted to European producers such as Eni, Repsol and Maurel & Prom also enabled exports to Europe to increase, almost tripling to 75,000 b/d in the period.

Title: Jorge Rodríguez: -It is very likely that we will have to hold ele...
Description: Jorge Rodríguez: -It is very likely that we will have to hold elections very soon--Depending on what we define and depending on what is decided, it is very likely that we will have to hold elections very soon,- said the president of the National Assembly, Jorge Rodríguez, on Tuesday, January 14, during the meeting with the political parties to prepare the electoral schedule for the three elections scheduled for this 2025 in the country: legislative, gubernatorial and mayoral, and legislative councils.He indicated that the governor of Esequibo Guayana should also be elected in 2025.Rodríguez added that consultations should also be held on the projects of popular power, and reiterated: -We do not have much time to define it.--What do we do? Do we hold mega-elections? Do we choose everyone or do we hold separate elections?- were some of the questions that Jorge Rodríguez asked during the meeting at the headquarters of the National Assembly, while he asked: -Do we hold an Assembly first, mayors first, governors? Title: Fanb rejects sanctions and rewards for officials: -Whoever messes...
Description: Fanb rejects sanctions and rewards for officials: -Whoever messes with one messes with all-The Bolivarian National Armed Forces (FANB), through the Strategic Operational Commander of the FANB, Domingo Hernández Lárez, made a televised statement against the sanctions imposed by the United States, the European Union and the United Kingdom against the Government of Nicolás Maduro.Hernández Lárez, like the commanders of each strategic region of integral defense, read the official statement to the country, in which they describe these measures as -desperate actions- against Maduro's inauguration.

Title: María Corina Machado denounces the arrest of more than 30 protest...
Description: María Corina Machado denounces the arrest of more than 30 protesters from 9E, including her motorcyclistOpposition leader María Corina Machado warned on Saturday of the arrest, in -the last few hours,- of more than thirty people by -repressive forces of (Nicolás) Maduro,- sworn in as president for a third six-year term in power, after his questionable reelection granted by the electoral body, controlled by Chavismo.-In the last few hours, more than 30 Venezuelans who were protesting peacefully and in an organized manner on January 9 were kidnapped by Maduro's repressive forces,- Machado said on the social network X, where she indicated that these events were recorded in Caracas and in 12 regions of the country.

Description: Venezuelan Embassy in Lisbon, Portugal, was attacked with -incendiary bombs,- according to the Venezuelan Foreign Minister, Yván Gil.-The irrational attacks of deranged groups will not stop the progress of the Bolivarian Revolution ,- he said in a message on Telegram.He also stressed that, thanks to the intervention of the Portuguese authorities, there was no major damage to the consular headquarters.He said he was confident that the investigations would lead to the perpetrators and determine the corresponding responsibilities .

Description: Gustavo Petro proposes repeating elections in VenezuelaColombian President Gustavo Petro has raised the possibility of holding new elections in Venezuela as a way to overcome the country's political crisis, one day after Maduro assumed power for a third term.-If the Venezuelan elections were not free, then they were held under an economic blockade that became an explicit extortion,- Petro said in a message posted on his X account.-It is important to maintain the thesis of the broadest possible political dialogue in Venezuela, the complete lifting of the blockade and a new possibility of free expression for the people of Venezuela,- he added.

Title: US authorities reactivate travel permits for Venezuelans: They wi...
Description: US authorities reactivate travel permits for Venezuelans: They will be able to advance in the entry processThe Department of Homeland Security (DHS) said that the processing of Advance Travel Authorizations (ATA) has been reactivated, which is important for applicants of the CHNV program (Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua and Venezuela) who seek to go to the United States (US), in order to request humanitarian parole.According to Diario Las Américas, citizens who have a valid and current ATA will be able to fly to the United States without impediment.Maria Herrera Mellado, a lawyer specializing in immigration issues, said that this advance -will allow beneficiaries with a valid ATA to board flights to the United States and advance in their process of entering the country.-

Title: Edmundo González: As Commander in Chief, I order the High Command...
Description: Edmundo González: As Commander in Chief, I order the High Command to ignore illegal ordersEdmundo González Urrutia sent a message to the country on the afternoon of Friday, January 10, hours after Nicolás Maduro was sworn in at the National Assembly (AN).-As Commander-in-Chief, I order the High Command to ignore illegal orders by those who seize power and to prepare my security conditions to assume the position of President of the Republic that entrusted me with national sovereignty. The soldiers of our National Armed Forces (FAN) are part of the same people and to whom they owe obedience through me.--I represent the will of almost 8 million Venezuelans within the country, and that of the millions of compatriots who were prevented from voting abroad, and I have the duty to defend that commitment.-In the same way, he sent a message to national institutions as -president-elect.--For the peace of the republic, you must disavow the illegitimate regime that has once again attempted to seize power. The institutionality of the nation that embraces you and your families is in your hands ,- he said.

Title: 🇫🇷🇧🇷 Macron and Lula ask Maduro to resume dialogue with the o...
Description: 🇫🇷🇧🇷 Macron and Lula ask Maduro to resume dialogue with the oppositionIn a coordinated effort to restore stability and democracy to Venezuela, Presidents Emmanuel Macron of France and Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva of Brazil have urged newly inaugurated Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro to reopen the channel of dialogue with the opposition.This request was confirmed in a statement issued by the French Presidency, following a telephone conversation between the two leaders on Friday, Swissinfo reported.In addition to promoting political reconciliation, Macron and Lula expressed strong condemnation of the attempted arrest of Maria Corina Machado, a prominent opposition leader, during a peaceful demonstration on Thursday.
